basics.name: Emily Pang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020.

courses: Intro to Computer Science I & II (Java)

highlights: Edit, create, and research program materials for various journalist seminars
Assist program coordinators in research in their various programs
Maintain an online database of fiscal and dispursing forms

volunteer.summary: Collaborated with a team of 6 other members for front-end and back-end programming. Created a web app for HECO that displays electric vehicle charging station information on a dashboard, and displays stations on an interactive map.

volunteer.position: University of Hawaii at Manoa Student Representative
volunteer.summary: Managed a workshop that taught girl scouts about how the internet works using packages as communication, and how it relates to their everyday lives.
Helped students with programming and debugging Java-based projects and homework.

Worked with a team of three other students to create an interactive board for the POST building on UH Manoa campus. Responsible for front-end programming to create custom elements and display designs. Used Javascript, HTML, CSS.
Assisted subsystem with building a GUI that was responsible for displaying feedback information from an autonomous boat. Used HTML, Semanic UI, React, Electron, and ROS.

awards.title: SEOTY A1-A3 Category Winner
awards.summary: Nominated by the East-West Center for Student Employee Of The Year.

awards.title: AIM Match 2nd Place Winner
awards.awarder: Hawaii Friends of NRA & Hawaii Rifle Association
awards.summary: 2nd place winner for the air riflery AIM Match.

awards.title: National Piano Guild Member
awards.summary: Passed National Piano Guild auditions after meeting the requirements of the handbook and being assessed by a judge.

awards.title: Susan Fukushima Piano School Highest Honors
awards.summary: The top scorer of all the students in the piano school who participated in the National Piano Guild Competition for that year.
